page.text: CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
Little Man Computer is an assembly language simulator
which gives an environment for users to program in an
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
• Accumulator - This is the like the active memory of the
simulator. The majority of our instructions will modify the
• Program Counter - This shows the current memory
location that the processor is running.
• MEM Address - The current instruction type.
• MEM Data - The data being used for the current
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
The input instruction takes the value in the In-Box and puts
After the value has been copied the Program Counter will
move onto the next (sequential) memory location.
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
The output instruction takes the value in the Accumulator
and puts the value into the Out-Box.
After the value has been copied the Program Counter will
move onto the next (sequential) memory location.
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
The halt instruction does not effect any of the memory
The execution of the program will stop.
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
• Create a program which takes in an input from the user
• Analysis the memory locations and write down the
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
The store instruction will take the data from the
Accumulator and store it into an allocated memory location
which will be referred to by the variable name given.
After the value has been copied the Program Counter will
move onto the next (sequential) memory location.
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
The load instruction will put the value stored at the variable
After the value has been loaded into the Accumulator ,the
Program Counter will move onto the next (sequential)
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
The data instruction will reserve a memory location to store
data. This location can then be referred to by the given
After the memory location has been reserved, the Program
Counter will move onto the next (sequential) memory
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
• Create a program which takes and stores in 2 inputs from
the user and outputs the first input followed by the second
• Create a program which takes and stores 4 inputs from
the user and always outputs the third input to the user.
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
The add instruction adds the value stored in the given
After the value has been loaded into the Accumulator ,the
Program Counter will move onto the next (sequential)
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
The subtraction instruction subtracts the value stored in the
given memory location away from the accumulator.
After the value has been loaded into the Accumulator ,the
Program Counter will move onto the next (sequential)
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
• Create a program which takes and stores in 2 inputs from
the user and outputs the sum of them.
• Create a program which take in three numbers and stores
them and then outputs the sum of the first 2 numbers with
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
Moves the Program Counter to the memory location stored
After the memory location has been loaded that memory
CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
• Create a program which allows the user to input numbers
indefinitely and outputs the number which was entered
• Create a program which allows the user to input numbers
indefinitely and outputs the running total after each entry.
• (Extension) Create a program which allows the user to
input numbers indefinitely and outputs the sum at each

CS-150: Concepts of Computer Science I
• Create a program which allows the user to input two
numbers and outputs the multiplication of the two
• Create a program which allows the user to input two
numbers and outputs the smallest number.
